articles.title: 'She grabbed a spoon and started filling the conditioner': Traveller praises Certis staff at Changi Airport T4 for act of kindness - AsiaOne

articles.content: It will be an early reunion for some families in China in 2023 as international borders reopen without the dreaded quarantine. The removal of many Covid curbs has come at a cost, which we will learn … [+452 chars]

articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Thailand brings back Covid entry rules for all international travellers - The Star Online
articles.description: Thailand will reintroduce Covid-19 entry requirements for foreigners flying into the country from Monday (Jan 9), the nation’s transport minister said, as the South-East Asian nation prepares for an expected wave of tourists from China.
articles.content: BANGKOK, Jan 8 (Bloomberg): Thailand will reintroduce Covid-19 entry requirements for foreigners flying into the country from Monday (Jan 9), the nations transport minister said, as the South-East As… [+1510 chars]

articles.title: UK palace allies push back against Prince Harry's claims in leaked memoir Spare - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: Veteran journalist Jonathan Dimbleby, a biographer and friend of King Charles III, said Harry's revelations were the type "that you'd expect … from a sort of B-list celebrity," and that the king would be pained and frustrated by them.
articles.content: Harry's book, Spare, is the latest in a string of very public pronouncements by the prince and his wife Meghan since they quit royal life and moved to California in 2020, citing what they saw as the … [+1985 chars]
